metadata.Title: CVE-2018-7439 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in FreeXL before 1.0.5. There is a heap-based buffer over-read in the function read_mini_biff_next_record. It was discovered that FreeXL did not properly handle certain input, resulting in a beap-based buffer over-read. If a user were tricked into opening a malicious Excel spreadsheet, FreeXL could potentially leak sensitive information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-7439` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libfreexl1 - 1.0.0g-1ubuntu0.14.04.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: freexl package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.0g-1ubuntu0.14.04.3').
